curam.util.intf
Interface DeferredProcessing

All Known Implementing Classes:
curam.util.base.DeferredProcessing
Direct Known Subclasses:
DeferredProcessingFactory
public abstract class DeferredProcessing
extends curam.util.base.DeferredProcessing

Provides facilities for application developers to invoke Business Process methods asynchronously. (Calls to asynchronous methods return without waiting for the invoked method to complete, hence 'deferred' processing).

See the Deferred Processing chapter of the Curam Workflow Management System Developers Guide for more information.

Method Detail

startProcess

public void startProcess(java.lang.String processName,
                         long instDataID)
                  throws AppRuntimeException
Used to invoke application-defined deferred process methods. Calls to this method return without waiting for the invoked process to complete (hence 'deferred' processing). However, the invocation of the deferred method is dependent on a successful commit of the the caller's transaction context. If the calling method's transaction rolls back, the deferred process will not be invoked (this safeguards application consistency).

Note: if this method is called outside of an Application Server, then the deferred process method call will be stored in a collection of deferred process method calls associated with the current transaction. At the end of the business interface method call, all of deferred process method calls made as part of the business interface call will be invoked synchronously (this is to allow unit testing of deferred processes).

Uses the global error handler set in the property curam.custom.deferredprocessing.dpcallback.

Parameters:
processName - The name of the deferred process to be invoked. This is not the name of a class method, it is the process name as defined in the Curam Workflow Management System Developers Guide.
instDataID - The ID of a record on the WMInstanceData table. WMInstanceData is an application-defined table that is populated with information required by the deferred process.
Throws:
AppRuntimeException - if a null or empty string is passed as a process name, or if the methods to start a deferred process or handle deferred process invocation errors cannot be found on the associated object.
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_ERR_JMS_INIT_FAILED - if a connection or session could not be created.
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_ERR_JMS_NO_CONNECTION - if there is no connection to the named queue.
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_ERR_JMS_MESSAGE_SEND_FAILED - if the JMS service reported any errors while trying to send the message.
AppRuntimeException - ID_ERR_DP_ENACTMENT - if any un-handled exceptions occur while enacting the deferred process.
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_INVALID_PARAMETER_EXCEPTION - if the processName parameter is empty
See Also:
startProcess - if setting your own Error handler is required.

startProcess

public void startProcess(java.lang.String processName,
                         long instDataID,
                         java.lang.String errorHandlerClassName)
                  throws AppRuntimeException
Used to invoke application-defined deferred process methods. Calls to this method return without waiting for the invoked process to complete (hence 'deferred' processing). However, the invocation of the deferred method is dependent on a successful commit of the the caller's transaction context. If the calling method's transaction rolls back, the deferred process will not be invoked (this safeguards application consistency).

Note: if this method is called outside of an Application Server, then the deferred process method call will be stored in a collection of deferred process method calls associated with the current transaction. At the end of the business interface method call, all of deferred process method calls made as part of the business interface call will be invoked synchronously (this is to allow unit testing of deferred processes).

The errorHandlerClassName parameter can be used to control what error handler gets invoked for this particular invocation.

Parameters:
processName - The name of the deferred process to be invoked. This is not the name of a class method, it is the process name as defined in the Curam Workflow Management System Developers Guide.
instDataID - The ID of a record on the WMInstanceData table. WMInstanceData is an application-defined table that is populated with information required by the deferred process.
errorHandlerClassName - The application-defined class which implements the TicketCallback interface and should be used to handle any errors occurring during invocation.
Throws:
AppRuntimeException - if a null or empty string is passed as a process name, or if the methods to start a deferred process or handle deferred process invocation errors cannot be found on the associated object.
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_ERR_JMS_INIT_FAILED - if a connection or session could not be created.
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_ERR_JMS_NO_CONNECTION - if there is no connection to the named queue.
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_ERR_JMS_MESSAGE_SEND_FAILED - if the JMS service reported any errors while trying to send the message.
AppRuntimeException - ID_ERR_DP_ENACTMENT - if any un-handled exceptions occur while enacting the deferred process.
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_INVALID_PARAMETER_EXCEPTION - if the processName parameter is empty

getDeferredProcessInfo

public ProcessInfoDetails getDeferredProcessInfo(ProcessNameKey processNameKey)
                                          throws DatabaseException,
                                                 AppException,
                                                 InformationalException
Looks up the subject field for a deferred process, based on the given process name. Also optionally looks up any errors associated with the run of this deferred process. This lookup is controlled by passing the Instance Data ID as part of the processNameKey.

Parameters:
processNameKey - The process name and ID for which to look up the subject.
Returns:
The process name and subject and any exception text for the given process name and ID.
Throws:
DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

getNewInstanceDataID

public long getNewInstanceDataID()
                          throws AppRuntimeException,
                                 AppException,
                                 DatabaseException
Returns a new unique ID for a deferred processing instance data record.

Returns:
A new unique ID for a deferred processing instance data record.
Throws:
AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_KEY_SET_NOT_FOUND - when the default Key Set cannot be found.
DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions
